Note:
Vertical shading represents NBER recession dates (approximately 1902 through 1904, 1907 though 1908, 1910 through 1912, 1913 through 1914, 1918 through 1919, 1920 though 1921, 1923 through 1924, 1926 tough 1927, 1929 though 1933, 1937 though 1938, 1945, 1948 though 1949, 1953 though 1954, 1957 though 1958, 1960 through 1961, 1969 though 1970, 1973 though 1975, 1980, 1981 though 1982, 1990 though 1991, 2001, and 2007 though 2009). Dashed line denotes trend (column 3 in table).
Source: For 1900-1926, Historical Statistics of the United States: Millenial Edition, table Ca9; for 1929-present, Bureau of Economic Analysis.
